programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Chinese War Kite"
programme.desc: Join Matt and Jeremy as they combine 13th century Chinese fire arrow technology with a 17th century Japanise kite design to see if they can command the battlefield with this amazing device.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S2 - "Building Bridges"
programme.desc: Our ancient ancestors had to come up with ingenious solutions and structures to travel freely - over the hills, valleys and rivers of our world.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "Roads That Changed The World"
programme.desc: Chariots were the express vehicles of their day – but how did they work? And what about the roads, tunnels, and bridges that they relied upon?

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "The Great Wall of China"
programme.desc: Since the earliest civilizations, humans have needed walls to protect them.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "Secrets Of The Pyramids"
programme.desc: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only survivor of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Its scale is breath-taking and it is built to precision.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "Rise Of The Super-Castle"
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, the technology of the castle evolved by leaps and bounds.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Sol Ownership: Can A Corporation Own The Sun?"
programme.sub-title: Sol Ownership: Can A Corporation Own The Sun?
programme.desc: Human needs have always created opportunities for human greed. And energy might be the most crucial need of all. Could we end up paying a subscription fee for sunlight?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S3 - "Pedestrian Protectoc"
programme.desc: Can we protect both pedestrians and drivers? Watch this episode to find out.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "Life Beyond Earth"
programme.desc: We look closely at the search within our solar system, Mars, Titan and the ice moons. Speaking with experts in their fields of Mars robotic missions, Nuclear scientists probing the structure of ice on the distant moons.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "The Next Great Extinction Event"
programme.desc: Experts explain our history and evolution of Earth over its 4 billion year history and take us through to the current emergency where humans may be one of the species to become extinct.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "A.I. The Code For Consiousness?"
programme.desc: Hollywood has made us rather fearful of Artificial Intelligence, or A.I. But as we shall see, A.I. and its dance partner robotics might not be the nemesis we should fear; at least, not if we get them right.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "Germ Warefare"
programme.desc: A new enemy is emerging. This new enemy is the natural world itself, a microscopic realm of bacteria. And not just any bacteria, but the so-called super-bugs. We'll look at the emerging threats and what scientists are doing to counter them.

programme.title: Secret Wars Uncovered S1 - "Coups Detat"
programme.desc: An uncompromising show of power, the military coup is an age-old method to violently and often secretly topple governments and take control by force. This episode goes behind the scenes of some of the greatest coups in recent history.

programme.title: Secret Wars Uncovered S1 - "The Gaza Offensive"
programme.desc: A mixture of political frustration and violent challenges led to the Gaza Offensive in 2014. As so many times over the past 13 years, Israeli soldiers launched brutally into the streets of Gaza, leaving destruction and death in their wake.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Dealers on a Mission"
programme.desc: Larry takes on an impossible mission: he’s been asked to find an item worn in space by Apollo 15 legend Al Worden. Torie searches for Russian space items for a museum in San Francisco and Cole goes on the hunt for an item from Apollo 13.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Money Trouble"
programme.desc: Larry gets the offer of a lifetime: a Soviet era space suit. Torie pays big for an Apollo 11 artefact but it’s not what it seems. Cole meets Apollo 7 legend Walt Cunningham.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "The Apollo Sale"
programme.desc: Torie’s son Jason joins her on the road. Larry turns ‘gastronaut’ when he comes across some space food; and a collector’s flash sale sees Cole bid for an Apollo 11 item with an incredible story.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Good Luck, Bad Luck"
programme.desc: Cole gets lucky when he finds a Russian space suit in an old box, but the gloves are missing. To find the gloves he has to strike a deal with Larry. Torie hears how Coke and Pepsi joined the space race and meets former NASA astronaut Winston Scott.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Tall Buildings, Fast Animals and Expensive Cities"
programme.sub-title: Tall Buildings, Fast Animals and Expensive Cities
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we explore tall buildings, fast animals, expensive cities and extremely impressive basketball records.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Long Lives, Destructive Weather and Speed Records"
programme.sub-title: Long Lives, Destructive Weather and Speed Records
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, you will learn about extreme close-up photography, long lives, destructive weather and speed records.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Physics, Space and Wealth"
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we’ll explore all things extreme in physics, space and wealth plus take a look at the smallest creatures on Earth.

programme.title: Extremes S1 - "Largest Animals, Human Bodies and Football"
programme.sub-title: Largest Animals, Human Bodies and Football
programme.desc: In this episode of Extremes, we will be exploring the largest animals, extreme facts about the human body and record breaking extremes in football and the field of music.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Terry's Criminal Mind"
programme.desc: A murderer tries to kill his final victim as the car they are in slowly sinks to the bottom of a lake. The only way to save the victim is to rescue her as the car continues to sink.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Shark Go Boom!"
programme.desc: Here, Chief Brody hangs on to his sinking boat as a giant shark approaches him with a scuba tank lodged in its mouth. We construct a shark on a platform to test if you can hit the tank with an M1 Garand rifle while perched in a precarious position.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "The Good the Bad and Terry"
programme.sub-title: The Good the Bad and Terry
programme.desc: In this classic western, Clint Eastwood – aka “Blondie” – saves Eli Wallach from the hangman’s noose three separate times by shooting and severing the rope that he hangs from. We test the reality of these shots with the weapons that were used.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Dying Hard"
programme.desc: John McLain (Bruce Willis) finds himself dangling from the side of a building. The only way to save himself is to shoot through the glass window and break through to safety.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Teaming up with NASA"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli visits the Sierra Nevada Corporation, which is building a spacecraft that can deliver cargo to and from the International Space Station.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Students of Space"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli looks at students who are becoming involved with space exploration.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Student-Astronaut Contest"
programme.desc: One lucky student wins the prize of going to Hawaii and experience the HI-SEAS habitat. Host Emily Calandrelli joins the contest winner in this special episode.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S5 - "Mission to Mars: The InSight Lander"
programme.sub-title: Mission to Mars: The InSight Lander
programme.desc: The InSight Lander is on its way to Mars. Host Emily Calandrelli discovers what it takes to prepare this spacecraft for its mission.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Space Telescope"
programme.desc: This episode focuses on the development of the Hubble Space Telescope and its successor the James Webb Space Telescope, a giant infra red instrument with the ability to see the most distant stellar activity.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Beyond the Solar System"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the effort involved in making the first photograph of a black hole and the search for planets orbiting distant stars.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Space Communication"
programme.desc: This episode examines the profit making satellite telecommunications industry and emerging techniques designed to increase the rates of data transmission from distant space probes.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Earth"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the growing understanding of the Earth’s complex climatic systems and the part on-orbit observation plays in the growth of knowledge about our planet.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "Biomimicry/Mechanimals"
programme.desc: Join host Joe Penna as he explores how designers are using Manta Rays to change the way we explore the ocean’s depths.
